noun.description: The part of the land near the sea; the edge of the land.
examples: they sailed further up the coast

noun.description: A run or movement in or on a vehicle without the use of power.

verb.description: (of a person or vehicle) move easily without using power.
examples: the engines stopped, and the craft coasted along

verb.description: Sail along the coast, especially in order to carry cargo.
examples: he coasted down the eastern shore

phrases: Once finally convinced the coast was clear, Gabby nonetheless tiptoed her way down the hall and slipped into the room.
Once the coast was clear the elf leaped gracefully from the tree and Miaku followed.
Once the coast was clear, he would get to the second floor somehow and then he would get to Juliet, hopefully before night fell.
He made his way out of the room once the coast was clear.
Our characters were supposed to look around to make sure the coast is clear, then jump in the truck and race off.
origin: Middle English (in the sense side of the body), from Old French coste (noun), costeier (verb), from Latin costa rib, flank, side. coast (sense 1 of the noun) arose from the phrase coast of the sea side of the sea.
